meanings.definition: The quality of being clear and transparent.
meanings.sent1: The limpidities of the lake allowed us to see the fish swimming below.
meanings.sent2: The limpidities of the glass made it easy to read the text on the other side.
meanings.sent3: The limpidities of the situation made it crystal clear who was telling the truth.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a limpidity that revealed her true emotions without words.
meanings.sent5: The limpidities of the diamond sparkled in the sunlight, dazzling all who beheld it.

meanings.definition: The state of being easily understood or expressed.
meanings.sent1: The limpidities of his explanation left no room for confusion.
meanings.sent2: The limpidities of the instructions made it simple to assemble the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The limpidities of the joke had everyone laughing in no time.
meanings.sent4: Her writing had a limpidity that captivated readers from the first sentence.
meanings.sent5: The limpidities of the concept shone through, making it accessible to all.
